verses.kjv: Set the trumpet to thy mouth. He shall come as an eagle against the house of the LORD, because they have transgressed my covenant, and trespassed against my law.
verses.web: “Put the trumpet to your lips! Something like an eagle is over LORD’s house, because they have broken my covenant, and rebelled against my law.
verses.ct: Sound the trumpet! An enemy swoops down on the house of the LORD like an eagle, because the people have broken my covenant and rebelled against my law.

verses.kjv: Israel shall cry unto me, My God, we know thee.
verses.web: They cry to me, ‘My God, we Israel acknowledge you!’
verses.ct: Israel cries out to me, "Our God, we know you!"

verses.kjv: Israel hath cast off the thing that is good: the enemy shall pursue him.
verses.web: Israel has cast off that which is good. The enemy will pursue him.
verses.ct: But Israel has rejected what is good, so the enemy will chase them down.

verses.kjv: They have set up kings, but not by me: they have made princes, and I knew it not: of their silver and their gold have they made them idols, that they may be cut off.
verses.web: They have set up kings, but not by me. They have made princes, and I didn’t approve. Of their silver and their gold they have made themselves idols, that they may be cut off.
verses.ct: They set up kings without my approval and chose leaders I never endorsed. They took their silver and gold and made idols for themselves — and it will lead to their destruction.

verses.kjv: Thy calf, O Samaria, hath cast thee off; mine anger is kindled against them: how long will it be ere they attain to innocency?
verses.web: Let Samaria throw out his calf idol! My anger burns against them! How long will it be until they are capable of purity?
verses.ct: Samaria, your calf idol disgusts me! My anger burns against its worshipers. How long will they be incapable of purity?

verses.kjv: For from Israel was it also: the workman made it; therefore it is not God: but the calf of Samaria shall be broken in pieces.
verses.web: For this is even from Israel! The workman made it, and it is no God; indeed, the calf of Samaria shall be broken in pieces.
verses.ct: This idol came from Israel itself! A craftsman made it — it is not God. The calf of Samaria will be smashed to pieces.

verses.kjv: For they have sown the wind, and they shall reap the whirlwind: it hath no stalk: the bud shall yield no meal: if so be it yield, the strangers shall swallow it up.
verses.web: For they sow the wind, and they will reap the whirlwind. He has no standing grain. The stalk will yield no head. If it does yield, strangers will swallow it up.
verses.ct: They have sown the wind, and they will reap the whirlwind. Their grain has no stalk; the heads produce no flour. Even if something grows, foreigners will devour it.

verses.kjv: Israel is swallowed up: now shall they be among the Gentiles as a vessel wherein is no pleasure.
verses.web: Israel is swallowed up. Now they are among the nations like a worthless thing.
verses.ct: Israel has been swallowed up. Now they sit among the nations like a worthless pot nobody wants.

verses.kjv: For they are gone up to Assyria, a wild ass alone by himself: Ephraim hath hired lovers.
verses.web: For they have gone up to Assyria, like a wild donkey wandering alone. Ephraim has hired lovers for himself.
verses.ct: They have wandered off to Assyria like a wild donkey roaming alone. Ephraim has sold himself to foreign lovers.

verses.kjv: Yea, though they have hired among the nations, now will I gather them, and they shall sorrow a little for the burden of the king of princes.
verses.web: But although they sold themselves among the nations, I will now gather them; and they begin to waste away because of the oppression of the king of mighty ones.
verses.ct: Even though they have sold themselves among the nations, I will now gather them together. They will begin to waste away under the oppression of a mighty king.

verses.kjv: Because Ephraim hath made many altars to sin, altars shall be unto him to sin.
verses.web: Because Ephraim has multiplied altars for sinning, they became for him altars for sinning.
verses.ct: Ephraim built altar after altar for sin offerings, but those very altars became places of sin.

verses.kjv: I have written to him the great things of my law, but they were counted as a strange thing.
verses.web: I wrote for him the many things of my law; but they were regarded as a strange thing.
verses.ct: I wrote out the many instructions of my law for them, but they treated it all as something foreign and irrelevant.

verses.kjv: They sacrifice flesh for the sacrifices of mine offerings, and eat it; but the LORD accepteth them not; now will he remember their iniquity, and visit their sins: they shall return to Egypt.
verses.web: As for the sacrifices of my offerings, they sacrifice meat and eat it; But LORD doesn’t accept them. Now he will remember their iniquity, and punish their sins. They will return to Egypt.
verses.ct: They offer sacrifices to me and eat the meat, but the LORD does not accept their offerings. Now he will remember their guilt and punish their sins. They will go back to Egypt.

verses.kjv: For Israel hath forgotten his Maker, and buildeth temples; and Judah hath multiplied fenced cities: but I will send a fire upon his cities, and it shall devour the palaces thereof.
verses.web: For Israel has forgotten his Maker and built palaces; and Judah has multiplied fortified cities; but I will send a fire on his cities, and it will devour its fortresses.”
verses.ct: Israel has forgotten his Maker and built grand temples, and Judah has fortified city after city. But I will send fire on their cities, and it will consume their fortresses.
